if %actor% * this is a wear trigger set myowner %actor% global myowner oechoaround %myowner% Bells ring on %myowner.name%'s hat as %myowner.n% moves. osend %myowner% The bells on your hat ring as you shift your position. else * this is a random trigger if %myowner% if %myowner.wearing[3306]% * the global variable was set (by the wear trigger) oechoaround %myowner% Bells ring on %myowner.name%'s hat as %myowner.n% moves. osend %myowner% The bells on your hat ring as you shift your position. else * hat not worn, so assume it was removed unset myowner end end end

* Generate a random number set p %random.15% * If this is being triggered by an imm as a speech trig, ensure something loads if %actor% && %actor.level% > 100 set p 15 endif if %p% != 15 halt endif * Figure out which object to load.  Better chance for lower vnums. set p %random.100% if %p% < 31 eval p 3139 + %random.7% elseif %p% < 82 eval p 3146 + %random.35% elseif %p% < 93 eval p 3181 + %random.10% else eval p 3191 + %random.7% endif * In case one of the randoms returned 0 somehow if %p% == 3139 set p 3140 + %random.58% endif mload obj %p% * Special handling for certain dolls: * Imanhotep's sarcophagus if %p% == 3182 mload obj 3199 mat 1100 open sarcophagus mat 1100 put imanhotep sarcophagus mat 1100 close sarcophagus * The Chosen boxed set elseif %p% == 3198 mload obj 3175 mload obj 3176 mload obj 3177 mload obj 3178 mload obj 3179 mat 1100 open boxed-set mat 1100 put chosen boxed-set mat 1100 put chosen boxed-set mat 1100 put chosen boxed-set mat 1100 put chosen boxed-set mat 1100 put chosen boxed-set mat 1100 close boxed-set endif

* This is a greet trigger for the transportation assistants who * move newbies between cities. switch %self.vnum% case 30075 case 3151 set myname barbarian break case 3152 set myname dwarf break case 30074 set myname drow break case 30076 set myname human break case 30077 set myname orc break case 3150 default set myname elf break done if %actor.level% < 16 && %actor.vnum% == -1 && %actor.quest_stage[intercity_transport]% == 0 msend %actor% &bThe %myname% tells you, 'Would you like a trip to a faraway city?'&0 msend %actor% &bThe %myname% tells you, 'If so, just ask me &7&bYes&0&b and I'll tell you all about it.'&0 end

if %actor.quest_stage[intercity_transport]% == 0 quest start intercity_transport %actor.name% endif switch %self.vnum% case 3151 case 30075 set myname barbarian set dest Ickle break case 3152 set myname dwarf set dest Anduin break case 30074 set myname drow set dest Anduin break case 30076 set myname human set dest Mielikki break case 30077 set myname orc set dest Ogakh break case 3150 default set myname elf set dest Mielikki done wait 3 if %actor.level% < 16 msend %actor% &bThe %myname% tells you, 'As long as you're under level 16, I can transport you to %dest%.'&0 msend %actor% &bThe %myname% tells you, 'Just ask me 'transport', and I'll send you.'&0 else msend %actor% &bThe %myname% tells you, 'I send people below level 16 to %dest%.'&0 msend %actor% &bThe %myname% tells you, 'Unfortunately, you are too powerful.'&0 end

* This is the receive trigger for intercity transport questmasters. * There are two systems of payment.  In the credit system, the scales * are worth different values.  When 9 credits are submitted, transport * takes place. * In the token system, a single scale is payment for transport. ** Currently, the scales are used as follows: ** ** white  (vnum 3150) ... 1 credit ** blue   (vnum 3151) ... 3 credits ** amber  (vnum 3152) ... 9 credits ** black  (vnum 3153) ... token for Nymrill ** violet (vnum 3154) ... token for Dancing dolphin inn ** ** The credit scales are used for going to Mielikki, Anduin, and Ickle. * The following switch statement has one case per transportation agent type. * By setting tokenid to a particular object vnum, the case statement * causes that agent to accept a single object of that type as full payment. * When tokenid is 0, the agent goes with the credits system. * Don't set maxlevel over 99. These guys cannot transport immortals, even * if we wanted them to. ******************* ** GENERAL SETUP ** ******************* switch %self.vnum% * This is the barbarian, who sends people to Ickle. case 3151 set myname barbarian set dvnum 10046 set dname ickle set dsname Ickle set tokenid 0 set minlevel 1 set maxlevel 15 break case 3152 * This is the dwarf, who sends people to Anduin. set myname dwarf set dvnum 6015 set dname anduin set dsname Anduin set tokenid 0 set minlevel 1 set maxlevel 15 break case 3153 * This is the human, who sends people to the Dancing Dolphin Inn. set myname human set dvnum 58704 set dname dolphin set dsname the Dancing Dolphin Inn set tokenid 3154 set minlevel 40 set maxlevel 99 break case 3154 * This is the gnome, who sends people to Nymrill. set myname gnome set dvnum 49501 set dname nymrill set dsname Nymrill set tokenid 3153 set minlevel 60 set maxlevel 99 break case 3150 default * This is the elf, who sends people to Mielikki. set myname elf set dvnum 3016 set dname mielikki set dsname Mielikki set tokenid 0 set minlevel 1 set maxlevel 15 break done ****************************** ** Check for proper payment ** ****************************** set credit_value 0 switch %object.vnum% case 3150 set credit_value 1 break case 3151 set credit_value 3 break case 3152 set credit_value 9 break done if %tokenid% != 0 * Here we have an agent who wants a specific item. if %object.vnum% == %tokenid% set credit_value 9 else set credit_value 0 end endif if %credit_value% == 0 return 0 mechoaround %actor% %actor.name% tries to give %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%. msend %actor% %self.name% refuses to take %object.shortdesc%. wait 2 peer %actor.name% msend %actor% &bThe %myname% tells you, 'I have no use for this!'&0 halt end *************************** ** Check for eligibility ** *************************** if %actor.level% > %maxlevel% return 0 mechoaround %actor% %actor.name% tries to give %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%. msend %actor% %self.name% refuses to accept %object.shortdesc%. wait 2 eyebrow %actor.name% msend %actor% &bThe %myname% tells you, 'You are too powerful for me to transport.'&0 halt elseif %actor.level% < %minlevel% return 0 mechoaround %actor% %actor.name% tries to give %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%. msend %actor% %self.name% ignores your offer. wait 2 shake msend %actor% &bThe %myname% tells you, 'You are not experienced enough to go to %dsname%.'&0 halt endif ********************* ** Process payment ** ********************* *** Check for unnecessary payment *** if %minlevel% == 1 && %actor.level% < 6 return 0 mechoaround %actor% %actor.name% tries to give %object.shortdesc% to %self.name%. msend %actor% %self.name% briskly refuses your offer. wait 4 msend %actor% &bThe %myname% tells you, 'You don't need to pay me yet.  Just ask me 'transport','&0 msend %actor% &bThe %myname% tells you, 'and I'll send you on your way.'&0 halt end mjunk %object.name% * Now do not attempt to access *object* below here! wait 4 if %tokenid% != 0 * A specific token is always worth the full price, so don't talk about credits. mechoaround %actor% %self.name% nods briefly to %actor.name%. msend %actor% %self.name% nods briefly to you. else * Work with the credits. * Ensure we have the quest variable for keeping track of submissions to this agent. if %actor.quest_variable[intercity_transport:%dname%]% else quest variable intercity_transport %actor.name% %dname% 0 end eval total_credits %credit_value% + %actor.quest_variable[intercity_transport:%dname%]% if %credit_value% == 1 msend %actor% &bThe %myname% tells you, 'That's worth one credit.'&0 else msend %actor% &bThe %myname% tells you, 'That's worth %credit_value% credits.'&0 end if %total_credits% < 9 quest variable intercity_transport %actor.name% %dname% %total_credits% eval credits_needed 9 - %total_credits% if %credits_needed% == 1 msend %actor% &bThe %myname% tells you, 'One more credit and I'll send you.'&0 else msend %actor% &bThe %myname% tells you, '%credits_needed% more credits and I'll send you.'&0 end halt end eval remaining_credits %total_credits% - 9 msend %actor% &bThe %myname% tells you, 'Alright then, off you go!'&0 if %remaining_credits% == 1 msend %actor% &bThe %myname% tells you, 'You have one credit left over.'&0 elseif %remaining_credits% > 1 msend %actor% &bThe %myname% tells you, 'You have %remaining_credits% credits left over.'&0 end quest variable intercity_transport %actor.name% %dname% %remaining_credits% end *************************** ** Set origination color ** *************************** * The color says where they came from. * It is seen by anyone standing at the destination. if %self.room% == 3016 * Mielikki - GREEN set dcolor &2green&0 elseif %self.room% == 6015 * Anduin - RED set dcolor &1red&0 elseif %self.room% == 49501 * Nymrill - BLACK set dcolor &9&bblack&0 elseif %self.room% == 58704 * Dancing Dolphin Inn - PURPLE set dcolor &5purple&0 elseif %self.room% == 16011 * Mystwatch - GRAY set dcolor &8&bgray&0 else * Ickle - BLUE set dcolor &4blue&0 end *********************** ** Perform transport ** *********************** wait 4 mechoaround %actor% %self.name% makes a magical gesture at %actor.name%. msend %actor% %self.name% makes a magical gesture at you. mechoaround %actor% %actor.name% disappears in a cloud of gray smoke. mteleport %actor% %dvnum% mat %dvnum% mechoaround %actor% %actor.name% arrives in a cloud of %dcolor% smoke. mforce %actor% look
mecho The purple-jacketed man cries out "Tropical paradise vacation!  Get away from the snow!"

* This is the ask trigger for intercity transport questmasters. * It allows level 1-15 people to get transport by asking to * Anduin, Ickle, or Mielikki. * Much of this trigger is a copy of 3152. ******************* ** GENERAL SETUP ** ******************* set minlevel 1 set maxlevel 15 switch %self.vnum% * This is the barbarian, who sends people to Ickle. case 3151 case 30075 set myname barbarian set dvnum 10046 set dsname Ickle break case 3152 * This is the dwarf, who sends people to Anduin. set myname dwarf set dvnum 6015 set dsname Anduin break case 30074 set myname drow set dvnum 6015 set dsname Anduin break case 30076 set myname human set dvnum 3016 set dsname Mielikki break case 30077 set myname orc set dvnum 30115 set dsname Ogakh break case 3150 default * This is the elf, who sends people to Mielikki. set myname elf set dvnum 3016 set dsname Mielikki break done wait 4 *************************** ** Check for eligibility ** *************************** if %actor.level% > 99 eyebrow %actor.name% msend %actor% &bThe %myname% tells you, 'Just goto %dvnum%.' halt elseif %minlevel% > %actor.level% shake msend %actor% &bThe %myname% tells you, 'You are not experienced enough to go to %dsname%.'&0 halt elseif %actor.level% > %maxlevel% eyebrow %actor.name% msend %actor% &bThe %myname% tells you, 'You are too powerful for me to transport.'&0 halt endif *************************** ** Set origination color ** *************************** * The color says where they came from. * It is seen by anyone standing at the destination. if %self.room% == 3016 * Mielikki - GREEN set dcolor &2green&0 elseif %self.room% == 6015 * Anduin - RED set dcolor &1red&0 elseif %self.room% == 30115 * Ogakh - GRAY set dcolor &9&bgray&0 else * Ickle - BLUE set dcolor &4blue&0 end *********************** ** Perform transport ** *********************** mechoaround %actor% %self.name% nods briefly to %actor.name%. msend %actor% %self.name% nods briefly to you. wait 4 mechoaround %actor% %self.name% makes a magical gesture at %actor.name%. msend %actor% %self.name% makes a magical gesture at you. mechoaround %actor% %actor.name% disappears in a cloud of gray smoke. mteleport %actor% %dvnum% mat %dvnum% mechoaround %actor% %actor.name% arrives in a cloud of %dcolor% smoke. mforce %actor% look

* This trigger is NOT USED because this system of trying to make * scales decay rapidly is far too unreliable. It doesn't catch on * to being picked up/put down very well. So instead, a timer is * put on the scales. It's rather long, but the scales will decay * even if held in inventory. Oh well. * * This is the trigger that causes spirit scales to decay rapidly * if not taken. oecho Scale: my room is %self.room% if %now_held% != 1 if %decay_counter% > 5 opurge %self% elseif %decay_counter% > 0 eval decay_counter %decay_counter% + 1 global decay_counter else set decay_counter 1 global decay_counter endif endif
* This trigger prevents transport quest spirit scales from * decaying after they've been taken. set now_held 1 global now_held
* This trigger causes transport quest spirit scales to decay * again once dropped. set decay_counter 1 global decay_counter set now_held 0 global now_held

* This trigger causes the mob that it's on to drop spirit scales * for the newbie city transport quest, sometimes. * Note: setting numeric arg on death trig seems to have no effect, * so the randomness must be handled thus if %random.10% < 4 if %self.level% < 3 && %random.10% < 7 set scale_vnum 3150 elseif %self.level% < 6 && %random.10% < 7 set scale_vnum 3151 else set scale_vnum 3152 endif mload obj %scale_vnum% end

%speech% /= earth set word2 earth set skill %actor.skill[sphere of earth]% elseif %speech% /= enchantment set word2 enchantment set skill %actor.skill[sphere of enchantment]% elseif %speech% /= fire set word2 fire set skill %actor.skill[sphere of fire]% elseif %speech% /= generic set word2 generic set skill %actor.skill[sphere of generic]% elseif %speech% /= healing set word2 healing set skill %actor.skill[sphere of healing]% elseif %speech% /= protection set word2 protection set skill %actor.skill[sphere of protection]% elseif %speech% /= summoning set word2 summoning set skill %actor.skill[sphere of summoning]% elseif %speech% /= water set word2 water set skill %actor.skill[sphere of water]% else say I've never heard of that sphere of magic before. endif elseif %speech% == meditate set skill %actor.skill[meditate]% elseif %speech% == vampiric touch set word2 touch set skill %actor.skill[vampiric touch]% else say I'm not familiar with %speech%. halt endif * * Check to see if a skill should be taught at all * eval skill 10 * %skill% eval maxskill %actor.level% * 10 + 60 * This portion is for smooth speech indicating the effects of a players cha or int score. if %cha% > 70 say You're a charming person. if %int% > 70 say ..and you are very quick witted. say I'll be delighted to give you a good rate. elseif %int% < 50 say ..but you aren't the smartest. endif elseif %cha% < 50 say I don't like you much. if %int% > 70 say ..but you are pretty bright. elseif %int% < 50 say ..and you aren't the smartest. say So this is going to cost you. else endif else say I wouldn't mind working with you. if %int% > 70 say ..and you're pretty bright. elseif %int% < 50 say ..but you aren't the smartest. say So, this is going to cost a bit more than usual. endif endif *Now a price is calculated eval change %maxskill% - %skill% eval opinion 200 - (%cha% - %int%) eval price %change% * %opinion% * %actor.level% * %actor.level% / (%skill% * 20) * *now the price in copper has to be divided into coinage. eval plat %price% / 1000 eval gold %price% / 100 - %plat% * 10 eval silv %price% / 10 - %plat% * 100 - %gold% * 10 eval copp %price%  - %plat% * 1000 - %gold% * 100 - %silv% * 10 *now the price can be reported say I'll teach you %speech% for %plat% platinum, %gold% gold, %silv% silver, %copp% copper. say Just get me the money, and I'll get started. quest variable trainer_3170 %actor.name% skill_name %speech% if %word2% quest variable trainer_3170 %actor.name% word2 %word2% endif quest variable trainer_3170 %actor.name% skill_level %skill% quest variable if %actor.quest_variable[trainer_3170:word2]% if %actor.quest_variable[trainer_3170:skill_name]% /= sphere set full_skill %actor.quest_variable[trainer_3170:skill_name]% of %actor.quest_variable[trainer_3170:word2]% else set full_skill %actor.quest_variable[trainer_3170:skill_name]% %actor.quest_variable[trainer_3170:word2]% endif elseif %actor.quest_variable[trainer_3170:skill_name]% set full_skill %actor.quest_variable[trainer_3170:skill_name]% endif wait 1s if %actor.quest_variable[trainer_3170:actor_level]% == %actor.level% if %value% >= %actor.quest_variable[trainer_3170:price]% grin %actor.name% wait 1s say Fantastic. Let's get started.. wait 5s msend %actor% Some time passes.. wait 3s msend %actor% You feel you are getting the hang of things. wait 3s msend %actor% You feel your skill in %full_skill% improving dramatically! mskillset %actor% %full_skill% quest erase trainer_3170 %actor.name% else say I appreciate your voluntary donation, but I'm afraid thats all it was. snicker %actor% say I don't except installments. It's got to be all up front. endif else return 0 wait 2s consider %actor% wait 2s ponder wait 2s say Something is different about you. What skill were you going to train again? quest erase trainer_3170 %actor.name% endif

wait 1s if %actor.quest_stage[trainer_3170]% == 1 if %actor.quest_variable[trainer_3170:lvl]% if %actor.quest_variable[trainer_3170:lvl]% == %actor.level% say Have you returned to be trained in %actor.quest_variable[trainer_3170:skill_name]%? halt endif endif say You've been gaining power, have you? Perhaps you could use some training? else tell %actor.name% Greetings adventurer. Are you looking for training? endif
if (%arg% == pool || %arg% == granite) oheal %actor% 400 return 0 endif

**Trigger is meant as a tear drop in memory of Pergus** osend %actor% A small tear drops from the corner of your eye as you garnish the rose. oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% sheds a tear as %actor.n% adjusts the rose.

wsend %actor% You bend over and carefully pluck the &9&bblack&0 rose from between the two hearts. **some command to directly load 3298 to player inventory** wechoaround %actor% %actor.name% bends over and carefully plucks the &9&bblack&0 rose from between the two hearts. wait 1 wecho Another identical &9&bblack&0 rose magically grows up in the same spot.
wait 5 sa If you would like to attend Newbie training, just say newbie. sa but this isn't quite ready yet, so come back later.

rooms.description: You are standing in the ancient wooded grove that has served as a druidic temple for untold centuries.  Natural living sculptures decorate the area, living tribute to Mielikki's love of nature.  Above you, the ancient trees form a natural green canopy.  This area radiates peaceful serenity and you know that you are perfectly safe here.  The temple altar is to the north.  The entrance to the Cleric Guilds lies to the west of here.  To the south, you can see the Town Center.

North.description: You see the altar of the Goddess Mielikki to the north.

South.description: The hustle and bustle of the Town Center lies to the south.

West.description: You see the entrance to the Cleric and Druid guilds to the west.

extra_descriptions: These trees have stood here, praising Mielikki for untold centuries.  Their mighty branches form a natural green canopy above the temple, reducing the effects of Mother Nature here, but not entirely eliminating them.

rooms.description: You stand before the altar of the nature goddess, Mielikki.  This is the place where Ariana Shelti, the high priestess of Mielikki, conducts the services of the nature goddess.  The main temple lies to the south.

You stand in one of this world's most holy places, the Inner Sanctum of the High Priestess to Mielikki.  The entire room is abundantly decorated with carvings of nature.  There is a large library in the northern part of the room, providing a good place to study.  The only exit is to the south.

This is the entrance to the Inner Sanctum's of Mielikki's Cleric, Druid, and Priest Guilds.  There is a large carpet laid out that gives a feeling of nobility to the room.  The Forest Temple lies to the east.  Light streams downward upon a circular staircase leading upward here.

The hustle and bustle of this living vibrant city is obvious here, on this marble-paved plaza.  Still, even here, the town's obvious closeness to nature is evident.  There are numerous well-tended trees here and the fountain at the center of the plaza is located in a large comfortable looking grassy area. Looks like a good place for a picnic.  The temple is directly north of this spot.  The fountain is to the south.  The Town Center itself continues on to the east and west.

Marble paving stones lie carefully interlocked beneath the shady branches of several well-tended trees.  The plaza continues east and south, and the sound of running water comes from the southeast.  To the north is a medium-sized wooden building, tidy and well-kept.  A sturdy building to the west has a sign proclaiming "Office of the Templar".

extra_descriptions: This is a low wooden building.  Its age is indeterminate.  It appears to be made of a local soft wood, which is stained from many seasons of weathering.

rooms.description: The hustle and bustle of this living vibrant city is obvious here, on this marble-paved plaza.  Still, even here, the town's obvious closeness to nature is evident.  There are numerous well-tended trees here and the fountain at the center of the plaza is located in a large comfortable looking grassy area. Looks like a good place for a picnic.  The Town Center continues on the the west and south.  Just north of here, you can see a well-tended cobblestone path, and to the east is Jorhan's stables.

The hustle and bustle of this living vibrant city is obvious here, on this marble-paved plaza.  Still, even here, the town's obvious closeness to nature is evident.  There are numerous well-tended trees here and the fountain at the center of the plaza is located in a large comfortable looking grassy area. Looks like a good place for a picnic.  The fountain is east of here.  The Town Center continues on the north and south.

The hustle and bustle of the village is nowhere as evident as here, the center of this plaza. The grass grows green and thick around it, with paths leading to its center, where a fountain bubbles. Some people sit and picnic, while others just mill around.

The hustle and bustle of this living vibrant city is obvious here, on this marble-paved plaza.  Still, even here, the town's obvious closeness to nature is evident.  There are numerous well-tended trees here and the fountain at the center of the plaza is located in a large comfortable looking grassy area. Looks like a good place for a picnic.  The fountain is to the west.  The Town Center continues on to the north and south.

The hustle and bustle of this living vibrant city is obvious here, on this marble-paved plaza.  Still, even here, the town's obvious closeness to nature is evident.  There are numerous well-tended trees here and the fountain at the center of the plaza is located in a large comfortable looking grassy area. Looks like a good place for a picnic.  The western part of Main Street begins to the west.  The Town Center continues on to the north and east.

The hustle and bustle of this living vibrant city is obvious here, on this marble-paved plaza.  Still, even here, the town's obvious closeness to nature is evident.  There are numerous well-tended trees here and the fountain at the center of the plaza is located in a large comfortable looking grassy area. Looks like a good place for a picnic.  The fountain is to the north.  The Town Center continues on to the east and west.

The hustle and bustle of this living vibrant city is obvious here, on this marble-paved plaza.  Still, even here, the town's obvious closeness to nature is evident.  There are numerous well-tended trees here and the fountain at the center of the plaza is located in a large comfortable looking grassy area. Looks like a good place for a picnic.  The Dark Alley begins to the south. The eastern part of Main Street begins to the east.  The Town Center continues on to the north and west.

You are standing on the main east/west running street here.  To the north is Santiago's Weapon Shop and the Warrior's Guild.  To the west, Main Street passes through the Town Center.  The eastern part of Main Street continues on to the east.
You are standing on the main east/west running street here.  The eastern part of Main Street passes through Commerce Square to the east as well as going on to the west.

This is the intersection of Main Street and Commerce Avenue.  You can leave the Square on Main Street by walking east or west.  You can also leave the Square on Commerce Avenue by walking north or south.
You are standing on the main east/west running street here.  The eastern part of Main Street passes through Commerce Square to the west and ends near the town's east gate just east of here.

You are now standing on the easternmost outskirts of the town, looking through a short tunnel to the town gates.  Who can say what exactly lies beyond the safe confines of the town, but it must surely be exciting!  Main Street begins just to the west of here.
You are standing just outside the town's eastern gates.  A path begins here and continues on to the west.  You can see some fields and light forest just to the east of town from here.

Santiago's Weapon Shop is decorated from floor to ceiling with paintings and other memorabilia of the most famous battles of the past century, all of which Santiago himself has fought in, usually on the winning side.  The shop looks like it is well stocked.  The main exit to the south will return you to East Main Street.  An exit to the east will take you to the entrance of the Warrior's Guild.

This is the entrance to the Inner Sanctum of the Warrior's Guild.  It is spartanly decorated with displays of curious ancient weapons as well as a few tapestries depicting epic battles.  The Inner Sanctum lies to the north. Santiago's Weapons Shop is to the west.

You stand in one of this world's finest arenas, the Inner Sanctum of the greatest War Coach to ever lead Mielikki's armies in the town's defense.  The entire room is almost entirely unadorned, except for a few pieces of the Coach's personal memorabilia.  It is indeed a privilege to be here.  The only exit is to the south.

You are standing on a major north/south running street here.  To the east is Lisa's House of Leather.  Just south of here lies Commerce Square.  The northern part of Commerce Avenue continues on to the north from here.
You are standing on a major north/south running street here.  Aaron's General Store is to the east.  The northern part of Commerce Avenue continues on to the north and south from here.

You are now standing in Aaron's General Store.  This seems to be a very roomy building with lots of storage capacity, although it isn't being fully utilized at this time.  Aaron must have plans for expansion.

You are standing at the north end of a major north/south street.  Helena's Bakery is to the west and you can smell the sweet smell of Helena's famous secret-recipe donuts from here.  The northern part of Commerce Avenue continues on to the south from here.

You are now standing in Helena's world famous bakery.  It is clean and well-tended to, obviously big factors in her success, but the biggest factor was what you smelled from the street outside, Helena's world famous donuts! Of course, where there are donuts...

You are standing on a major north/south running street here.  The southern part of Commerce Avenue continues on to the north and south.  A colorful-looking toy store, Freddy's Toys for Girls and Boys, is just to the east.

You are standing on a major north/south running street here.  To the east is Kayla's Pet Shop.  The southern part of Commerce Avenue ends to the south at New Castle Square and continues on to the north.
The noises of various pets all clamouring simutaneously echo throughout this structure.  Still, if you love animals, this must be close to heaven!  South Commerce Street is to the west.
Kayla's backroom, YOU SHOULD NOT BE HERE, tell a god.

You are standing in a dark and smelly alleyway running east/west from here. The Dark Alley ends to the west just south of the Town Center and to the east just north of the City Dump.  A pub with the sign of a drunken squirrel is directly south of here.

Marginally clean and organized, the interior of the pub is constructed mainly of wooden beams.  Just above the door, a large sign depicts a swaggering rodent holding a mug.  Tables are scattered about the room and a long bar runs along the south wall.
You are standing at the eastern end of a dark and smelly alleyway. Tr'ven's workshop is to the North, The City Dump is to the south and the Dark Alley continues on to the west.

This is the place where all GOOD citizens drop off the useless junk they no longer wish to lug around with them or pay to store elsewhere.  If YOU have useless junk you want to get rid of, this is the place to drop it!

This lovely little shop is spacious and elegant, with light-colored painted walls and a thick carpet on the floor.  A pretty glass lantern hangs from the ceiling, providing light.  Somebody clearly put a lot of thought into the decorations, for they provide an exquisite background for the three counters arranged tastefully around the shop.  Each counter holds inside its glass walls a small selection of jewelry.

This is the entrance to the Inner Sanctum of the Rogue's Guild.  There is one weak light coming from a small candle in the corner of the room.  The darkness combined with the shadows that never seem to stay still give this room an eerie feel.  The Inner Sanctum is down.  The Jewelry Shop lies to the west.

You are in one of this world's most insidious places, the Inner Sanctum of the Rogue's Guild.  There are various tools for the teaching of deceit and other conniving skills.  This training area is very dirty, and has not been kept up very well.  It provides the perfect setting to perform many acts, without being seen.

You are standing on the main east/west running street here.  To the south is Bigby's Magic Shop and the Mage's Guild.  To the east, Main Street passes through the Town Center.  The western part of Main Street continues on to the west.

You are standing on the main east/west running street here.  To the north, you can see the start of Sleepy Boulevard and the town's Inn.  To the west, Main Street ends at Smelter's Square.  The western part of Main Street also continues on to the east.

This is where Main Street and Smelter's Row mutually terminate.  You can leave the Square on Main Street by walking east.  You can also leave the square on Smelter's Row by walking south.  Immediately west of here lies the western gates of the town.

You are now standing on the western most outskirts of the town, looking through a short tunnel to the town gates.  Who can say what exactly lies beyond the safe confines of the town, but it must surely be exciting!  Smelter's Square lies just to the east of here.

You are standing just outside the town's western gates.  Farmer's Row begins here and continues on to the west.  You can see farmlands and thick forests just to the west of town from here.  The sounds of many insects emanate from the nearby farmlands.

This is the Magic Shop of the once-mighty wizard, Bigby.  Apparently he has decided to try to live the quiet life.  Perhaps this is all part of a plan that only another Mage could understand.  In any event, the Magic Shop seems to be well stocked with magical devices.  You can return to Main Street via the exit to the north.  To the south is the entrance to the Mage's Guild.

The magic being emitted through this room gives your body an uncomfortable chill.  There is a strong heat coming from above, and a cold breeze flowing from below.  The Inner Sanctum of the Mage's Guild lies to the east, and Bigby's Magic Shop is to the north.

You stand in an extremely magical place that may or may NOT be a part of this world, the Inner Sanctum of the Mage's Guild.  The entire room seems to only be loosely tied to this realm of existence, magic floats freely through the air.  With a little help, perhaps you can absorb some of it.  It is indeed a privilege to be here.  The only exit is to the west.
rooms.flags: NOMOB, INDOORS, PEACEFUL, BFS_MARK, GUILDHALL, ALWAYSLIT

rooms.description: You are standing on a major north/south running street.  To the south lies Main Street.  The Forest Inn is directly west of here and the Post Office is directly east of here.  Sleepy Boulevard continues on to the north.
You are standing on a major north/south running street here.  Sleepy Boulevard continues on to the north and south from here.
You are standing on a major north/south running street here.  To the north, Sleepy Boulevard ends inside the North Gate of the town.  Sleepy Boulevard continues on to the south from here.

You are now standing on the northernmost outskirts of the town, looking through a short tunnel to the town gates.  Who can say what exactly lies beyond the safe confines of the town, but it must surely be exciting!  Sleepy Boulevard begins just south of here.

You are standing just outside the town's northern gates.  To the north, you can see where The Great Road starts, leading north to Anduin.  All around The Great Road are swamplands, stretching as far as your eyes can see.

This is the entrance to the famed Forest Inn.  You have heard a lot about it for two reasons.  The Forest Inn is well-known for its comfortable rooms and friendly staff.  Also, it happens to be the only Inn around.

You are in the drinking extension of the Forest Inn.  Patrons and townfolk alike mix here freely over a brew at all hours of the day and night.  You are more than welcome to pull up a chair and join in as long as you can pay the rather hefty bar tabs.

This is the reception area, where customers check in and out of the Forest Inn.  Behind the counter, you can see many secure cubbyholes to store your equipment in and many, many rooms containing beds that look comfortable beyond belief.  Are you tired yet?

You are standing on a minor north/south running street here.  To the east is Granite's Shield Emporium and to the west is Drako's Bronze Shop.  To the north lies Smelter's Square, where Smelter's Row and Main Street both terminate. Smelter's row continues on to the south.

You are standing on a minor north/south running street here.  To the east is Beowyn's Armoury and to the west is Shauna's House of Iron.  Just south of here lies New Castle Plaza, where both Smelter's Row and New Castle Road terminate. Smelter's Row continues on to the north.

You are standing in Beowyn's Armoury.  Steel plates, ranging in size from mere inches to several meters across seem to be everywhere in this shop. Beowyn is obviously well prepared to handle any sudden surges in the demand for steel armours.  The atmosphere of this place makes you comfortable in spending your hard earned gold on Beowyn's armour -- anything made in a place like this could probably withstand anything short of dragon's breath!  The only exit from this place is to the west, back on to Smelter's Row.
You are standing in New Castle Plaza, the place where Smelter's Row and New Castle Road join.  Smelter's Row continues on to the north and New Castle Road continues on to the east.

You are standing on a major east/west running street here.  To the west, New Castle Road and Smelter's Row terminate at New Castle Plaza.  To the south, you see the splendor of the Royal Plaza.  New Castle Road continues on to the east.
You are standing on a major east/west running street here.  New Castle Road continues on to the east and west from here.
You are standing on a major east/west running street here.  New Castle Road continues on to the east and west from here.
You are standing on a major east/west running street here.  New Castle Road continues on to the east and west from here.  To the north is Mielikki Bank.

The road passes through a particularly dull section of the village here. Simple fences line both sides of the road.  There seem to be small dwellings, inaccessible from here, to the north.  To the south is a medium-sized building which also presents no obvious entrance.

This is a major east-west street in the heart of the village.  A nondescript fence lies to the south, while a wide building with a low roof squats to the north.  The sounds of conversation and dishes and a faint smell of fried food come from the building.

This east/west road terminates to the east in a small square.  It forms a T-intersection here with a minor street leading south.  To the north, a high wooden fence festooned with aromatic mistletoe stands.  Light whiffs of an unpleasant smell manage to pass through the fence from time to time.
You are standing in New Castle Square, where Commerce Avenue and New Castle Road both terminate.  Commerce Avenue continues on to the north and New Castle Road continues on to the west.
You are standing on a minor north/south running street here.  To the north, you can see New Castle Road.  Windy Way begins here and continues to the south.
You are standing on a minor north/south running street here.  Just east of here lies an old abandoned house.  Windy Way continues on to the north and south from here.
You are standing on a minor north/south running street here.  To the south, Windy Way ends at the town's South Gate.  Windy Way continues on to the north.

You are now standing on the southernmost outskirts of the town, looking through a short tunnel to the town gates.  Who can say what exactly lies beyond the safe confines of the town, but it must surely be exciting!  Windy Way begins just to the north of here.

You are standing just outside the town's southern gates.  A trail starts here and continues on to the south.  You can see a strange blue fog that seems to cling to the land to the south.  It looks somehow unnatural.  There is a large sign attached to a rusty post here.  It looks important!

South.description: You see the beginning of the Blue-Fog Trail.

extra_descriptions: The word rusty might be too kind. You wonder why it hasn't crumbled into a pile of dust. Its definately very old.

rooms.description: You are standing in the richly appointed Royal Plaza.  Carved from a single huge slab of marble, the Royal Plaza seems to cover an enormous area with not so much as a single flaw in its marble surface.  Regal indeed.  The Royal Plaza continues on to the east and south.

You are standing in the richly appointed Royal Plaza.  Carved from a single huge slab of marble, the Royal Plaza seems to cover an enormous area with not so much as a single flaw in its marble surface.  Regal indeed.  To the north is New Castle Road.  The Royal Plaza continues on to the west, east, and south, with a magnificent marble fountain to the south.

You are standing in the richly appointed Royal Plaza.  Carved from a single huge slab of marble, the Royal Plaza seems to cover an enormous area with not so much as a single flaw in its marble surface.  Regal indeed.  The Royal Plaza continues on to the west and south.

You are standing in the richly appointed Royal Plaza.  Carved from a single huge slab of marble, the Royal Plaza seems to cover an enormous area with not so much as a single flaw in its marble surface.  Regal indeed.  The Royal Plaza continues on to the north, south, and east, with a magnificent marble fountain to the east.

You are standing in the center of the richly appointed Royal Plaza next to the Royal Fountain.  Carved from a single huge slab of marble with a fountain built in to the middle of it, the Royal Plaza seems to cover an enormous area with not so much as a single flaw in its marble surface.  Regal indeed.  The Royal Plaza continues on in every direction.

You are standing in the richly appointed Royal Plaza.  Carved from a single huge slab of marble, the Royal Plaza seems to cover an enormous area with not so much as a single flaw in its marble surface.  Regal indeed.  The Royal Plaza continues on to the north, south, and west, with a huge marble fountain directly west of here.

You are standing in the richly appointed Royal Plaza.  Carved from a single huge slab of marble, the Royal Plaza seems to cover an enormous area with not so much as a single flaw in its marble surface.  Regal indeed.  The Royal Plaza continues on to the north and east of here.

You are standing in the richly appointed Royal Plaza.  Carved from a single huge slab of marble, the Royal Plaza seems to cover an enormous area with not so much as a single flaw in its marble surface.  Regal indeed.  The Castle Entrance is directly south of here.  The Royal Plaza continues on to the east, west, and north, with a huge marble fountain directly north of here.

You are standing in the richly appointed Royal Plaza.  Carved from a single huge slab of marble, the Royal Plaza seems to cover an enormous area with not so much as a single flaw in its marble surface.  Regal indeed.  The Royal Plaza continues on to the north and west of here.
This is the entrance to the fabulous Grey Castle!  It would appear that the Grey Knight and his Guardians are once again accepting visitors.  A person of virtue would certainly be welcome here.
This is where they store the pets...  You should NOT be here!

You are now standing in Drako's Bronze Shop.  The shop is not very well maintained, although it is far from slovenly.  Its obvious that Drako is very interested in keeping his overhead low, competing as he is with so many other armourers on Smelter's Row.  Still, the quality of Drako's work is apparent. You'll likely get your money's worth here.  The only exit from this place is east, back on to Smelter's Row.

You are now standing in Shauna's House of Iron.  Its obvious that Shauna has little faith in the new Steel process, as evidenced by the complete lack of steel armours in her shop.  Not to mention the disparaging anti-steel slogans hanging on her walls.  Nonetheless, Shauna has mastered the olden iron-working methods and her armours are of the very highest quality available.  Well worth the cost.  The only exit from this place is east, back on to Smelter's Row.

You are standing in Granite's Shield Emporium, the home of Granite the Shield Master.  Shields of all types adorn the walls.  You can certainly find any shield worth having in the selection here.  The only exit from this place is west, back on to Smelter's Row.

This large wooden building smells strongly of leather and furs. Stacks and piles of various leather goods, all around, are displayed, sometimes to advantage, sometimes not. Prices are marked carefully on each bin, stack, and rack. An open door leads west, to Commerce Avenue.

You stand in one of this world's most harmonious places, the Inner Sanctum of the High Druid to Mielikki.  The room seems almost alive and you feel closer to nature than you have ever been before.  The luscious plant-life here consists of the most beautiful flowers you have ever seen.  The only exit is to the east.
You are standing in the town's post office.  A place where you can leave private mail messages for other people who frequent the town.

This small building sees a lot of customers every day. Despite this, it is freshly swept and tidy. Orderly lines form up in front of a large marble counter at the northern end of the bank. The only exit stands to the south.
This cell is dark and a swampy moisture permiates the air.  Slime and moss dominate the walls of the cell and the bars of the cell door look ancient and nearly worn through.
rooms.flags: NOMOB, INDOORS, PEACEFUL, NOWELL, NORECALL, NOSUMMON, NOSHIFT

rooms.description: Jorhan's Stables are nicely constructed, and hardly reek of horse.  The fencing keeping the tamed beasts caged off is made of sturdy, formerly polished oak.  Jorhan has a small counter set up to do business on one side, and across from that are some stacks of grain and other animal foods.  The exit is to the west.
Jorhan's backroom, YOU SHOULD NOT BE HERE, tell a god.
rooms.flags: INDOORS, PEACEFUL, NOMAGIC, PRIVATE, NOWELL, NOSUMMON

rooms.description: As you enter your guildhall you are splashed with mysts that are seemingly falling out of the sky.  The pictures on the walls suggest that this room has been the home of water wizards for many years.  This room is much colder than any other room around these parts.  There is a light frost on the ground, which has been cast there for the sole purpose of experimentation.
rooms.flags: NOMOB, INDOORS, PEACEFUL, BFS_MARK, GUILDHALL, ALWAYSLIT

rooms.description: Your eyes light up as you enter your current guildhall.  There are fires buring on all sides creating a calm warmth throughout the room.  There are two main areas of study in this large inferno.  One located near a blazing chimney and the other, a more peaceful area, is located in the southern section.
rooms.flags: NOMOB, INDOORS, PEACEFUL, BFS_MARK, GUILDHALL, ALWAYSLIT

rooms.description: As you enter this room, you are astonished by its size.  There is a huge library containing many old texts to the left of you, and a huge study area to the right.  This is one of the most peaceful rooms in this small town, and Zeno, your guildmaster, assures that you wil be guided in the right direction.

This small room, no larger than a closet, is filed with a large quantity of scrolls.  These scrolls cover almost every inch of the room including its one table which is also host to a small lantern.  A small spiral staircase winds upward, but the clutter in the room makes it impossible to get to from here. The magic shop lies down.
Many weapons of all kinds decorate a large portion of the walls of this bright spacious room.  An elaborate coat of arms hangs on the east wall, well-lit by several tall candles.  The exit is east.

East.description: The shaded, marble-tiled plaza of Mielikki's Town Center lies to the east.

rooms.description: You are standing at the western end of a dark and smelly alleyway.  The Town Center is to the north and the Dark Alley continues on to the east.

You are standing if front of what looks to be a town sewer.  The smells and noises that bellow from the inside only make it seem more dangerous.  Rumor has it that a terrible mutation lurks in the sewers here.

Your first steps into the sewers here are climbing down and old rusty iron ladder that has somehow held together in the past few years.  Raw sewage trickles beneath your feet and a horrid odor reaches your nose.  The sewer pipes bend to the west and north.

The concrete walls here are begin to decay and crumble to dust.  Something that looks like and air vent is in the ceiling here but it looks much too slippery to climb to.  The sewer pipes lead to the east and west.

Something about this room seems not right, the room is in perfect order. The only thing that looks very strange here is two huge slime tracks in the middle of the room.  The sewer pipes lead to the east and west.

You can't see much here but the echo tells you that there's quite a sharp drop off.  You can just make out a huge dark pool of sewer water in the darkness, mostly because of the trickling of water.  The foul water from the sewer actually washes over this ledge and makes it quite treacherous.  The sewer pipes bend to the east and to the south.

This room too is in perfect order, except in this room the slime tracks seem to be very fresh!  Loud waves can be heard as putrid smells attack your nose. The sewer pipes lead to the north and to the south.
You are standing in mud up to your ankles.  This is a bend in the sewer with sewer pipes bending to the north and east.
This portion of the sewer has begun to fall into such a decay here that even the stone you walk on crumbles as you move your feet.  The sewer pipe continue to the east and west.
The raw sewage flows right at your feet, the stench growing with every step you take.  The sewer pipes continue to the west and east.
This is another wonderfully clean room.  The slimy trails in the middle of the room seem to be getting fresher the further into the sewers you go.  The sewers continue to the west and east.

The mud in this portion of the sewers is almost waist deep.  There is an air vent in the top of the sewer system here, but no fresh air seems to come from there.  The sewers continue on to the west and east from here.
The sewer system seems to be backed up here.  Piles of leafs have been gathering in for a long time.  The sewer pipe bends the the north and west.

This is the nastiest room down here in the sewers.  Everything here is covered in muck in here and is terribly horrid smelling.  Garbage here seems to flow to the west, but doesn't move further than a few inches.  The sewer pipes continue to the north and south.
This appears to be where the clean sparkling water leads into the sewers. This room is spotless and even looks like the water could be drinkable.  The sewer pipes lead on to the north and south.
The sparkling water here appears to be getting a little more dingy looking. There are a few beer bottles and rations floating down the sewer.  The sewer pipes bend to the west and south.
The sparkling water here has become gray and smelly.  Leaves and donuts litter the ground around the sewer pipe here.  The sewer pipes continue to the west and east.
Grey water slowly moves along its canal here.  The smell that floats from the water is that of dead fish and dung.  The sewer pipe bends to the south and east.
You are in the beginning of the Grand Sewer Pipe.  The pipes along here are spotless and all appear to be in perfect working order.
You are entering the heart of the sewers.  Growls and mumbling can be heard from furthers west.  The grand sewer pipe leads to the west to the east.
Nearing the end of the sewers, the chants and mumblings get louder.  A very fresh slime trail is slowly taking over the floor.  The grand sewer pipe leads from the west to the east.

The grand sewer pipe comes to an end here.  In front of you is some crumbled concrete that has fallen from the wall.  Piles of maggot dung amount up in the corner.  This room reeks of feces.  Spider webs hang from the ceiling, looking at them you wonder how many spiders had to have once been here to make such elaborate designs.

Bright colors adorn every corner and wall of this room, looking almost like a circus house.  Every manner of childhood dream can be seen on the shelves, from soft animal toys to carved wooden dolls to leathery footballs.

The mages guild is a place of books, and discussion.  Fecil, however, the guilds trainer, Imagines something very different.  To the far end of the room, you see bookshelves and tables for research.  The majority of the room, though, consists of open floors and practice dumbies made of solid wood.  Here you can ask Fecil about a magic skill you'd like to receive training in, and he will tell you how much you will need to pay him.

This room is lined with pillars with lit torches, casting shadows paternlessly around the room.  Nasty-looking weapons hang from the walls, glinting in the dim lighting.  Sacks stuffed with straw are cruedly tied to a few of the pillars, for practice landing the most devistating blows.  Julk is here, more than glad to accept your money in exchange for teaching you what it takes to be more effective at taking more money from others.

This room is quite busy, with guards and advernturers alike practicing their defensive skills.  There are a variety of shields and large weapons leaning or hanging on racks for the paying student.  Calken, the trainer, is coaching the various students around the room, as he paces the length of the facility.  You can ask him about the skills being practiced here, and once you've paid, you can join in.

From floor to roof the shop is spotless.  Tools and weapons shimmer as they rest around the room.  Near the center of the room there is a lone workbench, cleared of the last project.  You can see the Dark Alley just out the door to the south.

Grey stones surround this narrow passageway, which only allows the most minute amounts of light in through its slender windows. A grand spiral staircase leads down, deep into the grey castle, while a large metal gate guards the entrance north into what may seem a lush and thriving garden.

North.description: A metal gate lays to the north

extra_descriptions: Large black metal gates bar the entrance north into the garden. There appears to be something written on the main support of the grand gates, it reads: "Dedicated to the memory of our beloved friend and mentor Pergus, Rick Sala, this 9th Day of July, 2006."

rooms.description: The surrounding foliage provides a feeling more like a forest glade than a garden.  Even though none are visible, the soft sounds of a deer's scuffling hooves can be heard along with the sounds of salmon splashing upstream and ravens squawking their morning tune.  In the center is a clearing lit by shafts of sunlight, filtering down through the canopy of leaves above.  The shafts make a circle and outline a ring of finely crafted granite stones set into the ground.  In the center of the circle stands a large oak tree.  The garden gate lies to the south, while the garden continues to the west, north, and east.

South.description: A metal gate lays to the south.

extra_descriptions: The Druid's life, as it be known, Is carved for all upon the stone To leave a lasting legacy For all who open eyes to see. So enter, breathe its air, Discover life's true meaning there, Written within the stars, so bright, Your path of everlasting light. Then set your foot upon this path And do not contemplate the math. The sky, unfurled before you now Will sanctify your sacred vow. The Druid's circle, once complete, Will lay its blessings at your feet And bring your spirit home, at last, To a garden of peace and love so vast.

rooms.description: The refreshing, bright green of sunlight through new leaves is the first noticeable sensation in this part of the garden.  Tiny, jewel-like flowers push themselves up out of a rich black soil imported from the farthest corners of the world.  A trellis made of living oak saplings grows here, branches intertwining and woven through with morning glory vines, gifting the garden with a constant, peaceful rustling of growing plants.  Soft chittering sounds are the only indication of the small animals that call this place home, aside from their tiny tracks in the soil.  A relaxing feeling sweeps around everything that enters here, giving peace to even the most stressed adventurers.  In the center of this section of the garden stands a grey stone altar carved with the symbol of a flame, and a tiny silver flame at the top of the altar is always lit despite the breeze.

extra_descriptions: Young, vigorous oak saplings have set their roots into the black soil and have been coaxed by the druids to grow into a canopy above the garden, shielding it from harsh weather and giving those who walk under it a beautiful green light by which to see.  Reaching for the sun are flowers of a deep purple growing from vines: the short-lived but exquisitely beautiful morning glory, symbolizing transience.

rooms.description: A large and expansive rose garden expanding to the edges of reality.  At the very center of the garden are two large white marble hearts encompasing a &9&bblack&0 rose in the center.

extra_descriptions: A single &9&bblack&0 rose stands erect at the center of attention between the two hearts. This final farewell stands for all to see. Perhaps you should pluck it so you too will have something to remember him by.

rooms.description: Calm and utterly quiet, this peaceful garden seems an ideal location for a moment's reprieve.  The only sounds that can be heard are those of the local wildlife as they scurry about in search of whatever it is wildlife does.  This area of the garden itself is surround with a large hedge that extends along the entire western edge of the area, blooming with multicolored buds that seem to attract the interest of the local insect population.  In the center of the area is an ancient willow tree that dominates the entire area with its presence and provides a comforting place for the weary to relax.  The willow tree itself hangs down from above and sways in the light breeze as small birds can be seen flying into and out-of its large branches.  Surrounding the large willow is a simple wooden fence which only stands approximately 3 feet above the ground, is almost completed engulfed in rows of ivy, and is outlined by rows of flowers of almost every shape and colour.

extra_descriptions: The inscription written into this large willow reads: Rick Sala: June 1st, 1974 - June 21st, 2006 A dear friend, although your are gone you shall not be forgetten, for you memory and spirit lives on in all that we do and all that this represents.

rooms.description: Caught in a dream, an imaginary light, construed by the soul that entices the crystal clear sky.  A firm grasp of lush green vine nuzzles closely among its kinsman while combing the blue glow, haunting the air as fine myst lessens sight.  Violet tipped grass blankets firm ground in all stretches, a brush of beauteous sirens of the wisp nay the entrancing fear.  An aura of nobility and a humbling staff lie tarnished in the nesting of the statue. In both the unforeseen and the clear bequeaths harmony with confusion among the simple unseen briars hidden among the grassy knoll.  A lingering lace of unspoken heart-works are left in the sword that leads in pierced earth.  All are halted within spirit and flesh amidst the isle of the Druid.

Swaying slightly in an ethereal breeze, the beautiful white blossoms of well-groomed apricot trees dance silently in the air.  The magnificent white trees stand at each corner of this part of the garden, leaning in towards each other.  Draped between them, vines of white and green variegated ivy grow across the open air, creating a pleasant criss-crossed canopy above. Surrounding the base of each tree, brilliant growths of bush lily and cornflower have been cultivated up each trunk, the flowers forming elaborate patterns across the bark.  In the center of the garden, a diamond-shaped pearlescent pool collects water as it cascades down a tall, pyramidal fountain rising from the middle of the pool.  Seven matching black opal benches encircle the fountain, their smooth, polished surfaces glinting in the light.  A pitch-black cobblestone path lies between the benches and the fountain, its dark marble in stark contrast with the white blossoms of the trees above it. Spherical lanterns hover motionless at each corner of the pool, projecting a holy glow across their surroundings.  Their light illuminates the room as the sun, yet directly they appear muted and soft.  A peaceful tranquility permeates the atmosphere here, creating a sense of consecration and eternity.

extra_descriptions: The pool's pearly exterior depicts detailed scenes and symbols in light, bas-relief etchings.  One scene records a commanding druid, arms outstretched among the nature around him, exuding a sense of natural harmony.  Another image shows a man engulfed in fire, molten streams of lava coursing on the ground around him.  Six monstrous rats are drawn before him, their sharply-fanged snouts facing outwards from his figure.  Continuing around the pool, the third image portrays the same man engulfed by fire standing above the curvature of the world, his right arm sweeping across its face creating forest and desert alike in its path.  The fourth and final etching illustrates another man, standing beside a woman and cradling a young girl in his arms.  They stand among a background of lightly etched roses.

rooms.description: This looks to be a small, pleasant sitting room.  Bland, calming portraits hang from the whitewashed walls above padded chairs and a small sofa.  The seats are arranged around the center and eastern parts of the room, away from the south exit which is in the southeast corner.  There are no windows.

A cool breeze carries the fresh scent of the garden.  A light mist can be felt in the air.  Passing through a bamboo gate, you come upon a field of green grass.  In the center of the field, five short stone pillars form a circle around a majestic granite pool.  Standing in the center of the pool, a brass crane elegantly spouts a stream of flowing water into the pool.  Torches burn atop each of the pillars.  There appears to be inscriptions at the base of each pillar.  The sound of children playing in the green grass can be heard all around.

extra_descriptions: There is a name at the base of each pillar.  Daroowise, Nameless, Trystan, Brilan, and Pergus.

rooms.description: This is a large, pleasant room, beautifully inlaid with mahogany and papered with soothing designs.  There is no trace or sign of dirt, clutter, or imperfection anywhere.  Lilies sit in amber vases on small marble tables while sconces burn smokelessly on either side of the crackling fire.  It is dark, but not oppressively so; there is room and time to think.  An exit leads north.

The air above the peaceful garden below swirls and blows perpetually with a mix of gentle caress and ferocity assailing the flesh.  The air glitters and sparkles with a variety of color transitioning from red so bright it sears sight to black so deep the darkness sucks upon the body and soul alike to brilliant blues making the most valuable sapphire pale beside it to warm minglings of yellows, greens, and oranges.  Through the center of the air however beams a solitary never-dulling light pristinely focused upon the statue which stands below.  This column of light is impenetrable to any weapon, force, or attack and forever will shine upon, illuminate, and protect the druid below.

extra_descriptions: For the strength and solidarity provided by our now absent friend and mentor. Peace upon your soul Rick, Pergus, Daroowise.  You shall be forever missed. -Tanle retired Implementor and Friend - July 2006

rooms.description: This room is decorated with weapons of every imaginable type, sadly they are behind unbreakable glass, or you would grab a few to test out.  The moldy smell leads you to believe you have gone down farther than 1 level, but you do feel safe here.
You are in an unfinished room.
You are in an unfinished room.
You are in an unfinished room.
You are in an unfinished room.
You are in an unfinished room.
test room

This vast room is filled nearly to overflowing with every possible oddity.  Unidentified things jut out at all angles from shelves, boxes, and assorted containers.  All horizontal workspace is buried deep in a multitude of scrolls, tomes and technical journals.  You wonder just what kind of madman could call a place like this home?
rooms.flags: INDOORS, PRIVATE, GODROOM, NOWELL, NOSUMMON, NOSHIFT
